selected_quotes: Only known hibernating primate has unique sleep patterns

citation.abstract: It has long been suspected that sleep is important for regulating body temperature and metabolic-rate. Hibernation, a state of acute hypothermia and reduced metabolic-rate, offers a promising system for investigating those relationships. Prior studies in hibernating ground squirrels report that, although sleep occurs during hibernation, it manifests only as non-REM sleep, and only at relatively high temperatures. In our study, we report data on sleep during hibernation in a lemuriform primate, Cheirogaleus medius. As the only primate known to experience prolonged periods of hibernation and as an inhabitant of more temperate climates than ground squirrels, this animal serves as an alternative model for exploring sleep temperature/metabolism relationships that may be uniquely relevant to understanding human physiology.
citation.title: The Relationship of Sleep with Temperature and Metabolic Rate in a Hibernating Primate

news.title: Winterschlaf: Ein träumender Lemur
news.summary: Ein Maki auf Madagaskar ist nicht nur der einzige bekannte Primat, der Winterschlaf hält. Er überrascht Wissenschaftler auch mit seinem ungewöhnlichen Verhalten in diesem Zustand.

news.title: World's Only Hibernating Primate Has Strange Sleep Patterns
news.summary: The fat-tailed dwarf lemur hibernates for about seven months each year, and significantly drops its metabolic activity during that time. Researchers have now shown for the first time that the animal still requires bouts of sleep during hibernation.

news.title: Only known hibernating primate has unique sleep patterns
news.summary: Fat-tailed dwarf lemurs are the only primates known to hibernate, and new research suggests their sleep patterns during hibernation are markedly different from those of ground squirrels, which also hibernate at similar temperatures.

author.name: Txchnologist
author.description:
Txchnologist is an online magazine sponsored by GE. Every week, we offer an optimistic, but not utopian, take on the future and humanity’s ability to tackle the great challenges of our era through industry, technology and ingenuity.

We cover science and technology with an eye toward what is possible now and what will be tomorrow in renewable energy, transportation, infrastructure, artificial intelligence and other topics. Txchnologist will offer a blend of stories and visuals that communicate the ideas that will shape societies, from the developing world to our frenetic and growing cities.

Txchnologist, while sponsored by GE, takes a broader look at the world of science and technology. The stories and opinions do not necessarily reflect the views of the company.

We hope you’ll join the conversation in the comments section and share our stories on Twitter, Facebook, or Google Plus.

wikipedia.title: Fat-tailed dwarf lemur
wikipedia.summary: The fat-tailed dwarf lemur (Cheirogaleus medius), also known as the lesser dwarf lemur, western fat-tailed dwarf lemur, or spiny forest dwarf lemur, is one of the smallest primates.
